author: Cindy Clark
title: Oscar fail 2017: Celebs are shocked, jokes aboundhttps://twitter.com/MissUniverse/status/836086012950503426
text:
Mass confusion. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, Robert Deutsch-USA TODAY NETWORK)
Um, say what? Did that just happen? If you were watching the Oscars during the epic fail that was the announcement of the WRONG best picture winner, you're probably still shaking your head at the cringe-inducing botch. And so are celebs everywhere, who, like us, cannot believe what just transcribed.
"I would not wish that situation on my worst enemy," David Oyelowo told us at the post-Oscars Governor's Ball. "That was a tough way to find that you lost and a tough way to find out that you won. No one could really celebrate as fully as they would like but I'm elated for the Moonlight cast and I feel badly for the La La Land folks."
An empathetic reaction, indeed. Many felt the same way, but the snafu was also a prime opportunity to make some jokes. One organization that has some experience with this kind of thing was quick to react:
Have your people call our people - we know what to do. #Oscars #MissUniverse
— Miss Universe (@MissUniverse) February 27, 2017 Let the OMG-ing and Steve Harvey jokes commence.
Gee, I'm glad I stayed up! That was a first!!!!
— Bette Midler (@BetteMidler) February 27, 2017 Oh my God!!!!
— Jessica Chastain (@jes_chastain) February 27, 2017 Summary:
Deserved win by the Moonlight team
Gracious concession by the La La Land team
wtf just happened for everyone else #Oscars
— Ryan Seacrest (@RyanSeacrest) February 27, 2017 Wh ??!congratulations Moonlight! My favorite #Oscars in memory!!
— Oprah Winfrey (@Oprah) February 27, 2017 OMG did you all see this moment?! https://t.co/gbmGGld2fy
— Rachel Zoe (@RachelZoe) February 27, 2017 America's next top Model is LaLa. OOPS! I meant Moon.
— Tyra Banks (@tyrabanks) February 27, 2017 IT ALL COMES DOWN TO WARREN AND FAYE!
— Andy Cohen (@Andy) February 27, 2017 M. Night Shyamalan (@MNightShyamalan) | Twitter
I wrote the ending of the academy awards 2017. @jimmykimmel we really got them!
— M. Night Shyamalan (@MNightShyamalan) February 27, 2017 THAT. WAS. CRAZY. #Oscars .
— Ross Mathews (@helloross) February 27, 2017 Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2lKXhwE
